sentences.sContent: On arrival, she buys a glass factory on a whim, and challenges him to transport a church built entirely of glass by boat from Sydney 250 miles up the coast.
sentences.sContent_eng: On arrival, she buys a glass factory on a whim, and challenges him to transport a church built entirely of glass by boat from Sydney 250 miles up the coast.
sentences.sCn: 到达目的地后，她突发奇想买了一个玻璃厂，并向他挑战，让他用船沿着 250 英里长的海岸线从悉尼运来建造一整座玻璃教堂。

sentences.sContent: An idle whim, I fear, sir,' was my answer; `or else an idle whim is going to spirit me away.
sentences.sContent_eng: An idle whim, I fear, sir,' was my answer; `or else an idle whim is going to spirit me away.
sentences.sCn: “恐怕是一种无聊的奇想，先生，”这是我的回答，“不然就是一种无聊的奇想又要诱使我走开。

synos.tran: 奇想；一时的兴致；怪念头；幻想

trans.tranOther: a sudden feeling that you would like to do or have something, especially when there is no important or good reason
